title: LLM dialogues Blog
text:
7 habits of top AI users



Building Stuff

Prompts



Seven habits, from optimizing input/output speed with dictation, to deeply integrating AI into daily tasks, leveraging conversational modes, building custom projects, strategically using multiple models and staying updated on trends.





Jul 10, 2025












LIFECYCLE-INVESTMENT A optimal-fixed-weight strategy



Investing & Global politics

PDF chat



Gemini 2.5 Flash Preview and Gemini 2.0 Flash models are great for dealing with Pdf’s - also in explaining graphs and figures!





Jul 2, 2025












McKinsey: CEO playbook for AI agents



AI in Business

McKinsey

PDF chat

Slide presentation



The McKinsey report: Seizing the agentic AI advantage, A CEO playbook to solve the gen AI paradox and unlock scalable impact with AI agents





Jun 26, 2025












Behind the Scenes of Landing Clients in AI Services



AI in Business



A detailed guide on the client lifecycle in AI services, from lead onboarding to project delivery and maintenance, emphasizing practical steps and community engagement.





Jun 19, 2025












Y Combinator: State-Of-The-Art Prompting For AI Agents



Building Stuff

Prompts



On the Lightcone, Garry, Harj, Diana, and Jared break down what they’ve learned from working with hundreds of founders building with LLMs: why prompting still matters, where it breaks down, and how teams are making it more reliable in production. They share real examples of prompts that failed, how companies are testing for quality, and what the best teams are doing to make LLM outputs useful and predictable.





Jun 19, 2025












Andre Karpathy: Software is changing



AI Technology

Andrej Karpathy



Andre Karpathy’s talk on the evolution of software in the era of AI, discussing Software 1.0, 2.0, and 3.0, the role of LLMs, and the future of programming.





Jun 19, 2025












The Truth Behind Selling AI Automations To Small Businesses!



AI in Business



A realistic perspective on selling AI automations to small businesses, focusing on practical problem-solving rather than cutting-edge AI.





Jun 12, 2025












Lessons learned from building AI automations



Building Stuff

AI in Business

AI Automation









Jun 11, 2025












Make my Own LLM Evals



Building Stuff

Evals



This is a general workflow to create custom LLM Evals based on the steps outlined in the video. It includes generating outputs, manual annotation, categorizing feedback, defining evaluation criteria, creating LLM judges, implementing automated evaluation, and refining the agent’s prompt.





Jun 11, 2025












Karen Hao: Empire of AI



AI Technology

AI Ethics



Karen Hao discusses her book “Empire of AI,” which critiques the AI industry’s resource extraction practices, environmental impacts, and the socio-political implications of AI development, particularly focusing on OpenAI and its founder Sam Altman.





Jun 10, 2025












Sundar Pichai, CEO of Google and Alphabet



AI Technology



Lex Fridman’s podcast with Sundar Pichai, CEO of Google and Alphabet, AI’s impact on society, and the future of technology.





Jun 6, 2025












The Top Down Approach of AI for Business



AI in Business

Slide presentation



The top-down approach to AI implementation in business, emphasizing the importance of aligning AI initiatives with business strategy and specific problems rather than starting with data and technology.





Jun 5, 2025












James Medoo: Google Astra Is Disrupting Teaching in 2025



AI in Education



James Mik discusses how Google’s Project Astra is transforming education by enabling “just in time” learning through AI, moving away from traditional course models. He illustrates this with examples of AI-assisted problem solving in math and bike repair, emphasizing the need for educators to adapt their business models to focus on personalized support and outcomes rather than comprehensive courses.





May 28, 2025












Andrew Ng: State of AI Agents



AI Technology

Andrew Ng

AI Agents



Andrew Ng’s fireside chat with LangChain, discussing the state of AI agents, agenticness, and practical applications in AI development, 28. maj 2025





May 28, 2025












Ryan Carson at How I AI: A 3-step AI coding workflow for solo founders



Building Stuff

Prompts

Coding



Ryan Carson is a five-time founder who has spent the past 20 years building, scaling, and selling startups. In this episode, he shares his playbook for using AI to build products, turning “vibe coding” into a structured and scalable approach that can replace full engineering teams.





May 27, 2025












Devin Kearns: 9 Things I Wish I Knew Before Starting an AI Company



AI in Business



Devin Kearns shares nine key lessons learned from his experience building an AI company over the past 8-9 months. The video covers practical insights on agentic prompting, model selection, custom tooling and the importance of UI/UX.





May 26, 2025












Msty Studio Tutorials



Building Stuff



A collection of detailed tutorials on using Msty Studio, covering advanced features like Turnstiles, Toolsets, and Sidecar for local AI integration.





May 26, 2025












Devin Kearns: Agentic Operating Systems’ are the FUTURE of AI & Business



AI in Business



Devin Kearns discusses the evolution of AI agents, introducing the concept of Agentic Operating Systems (Agentic OS) as the future of AI and business. He outlines three phases of AI agent development, defines Agentic OS, and envisions a future where personal and business agents operate autonomously within interconnected data sandboxes.





May 26, 2025












Cole Medin: How I’d Learn AI Agents FAST



Building Stuff

n8n

AI Agents



Cole Medin shares a detailed roadmap for learning AI agent development quickly, covering everything from foundational knowledge to advanced deployment and collaboration.





May 26, 2025












Eduards Ruzga: Claude + Bright Data MCP



Building Stuff

Coding

MCP



Eduards Ruzga demonstrates how AI tools like Claude combined with Bright Data’s MCP can function as a powerful career coach and research assistant, showcasing practical applications in job searching and career advancement.





May 15, 2025












Sam Altman on future of work



AI Technology

Sam Altman



Wes Roth summarizes key insights shared by Sam Altman at the Sequoia Capital AI Ascent event on May 12, 2025.





May 13, 2025












Sam Altman on OpenAI’s vision



AI Technology

Sam Altman



Sam Altman’s vision for OpenAI, particularly the concept of a “Core AI Subscription”, as discussed in his interview with Sequoia Capital on May 12, 2025.





May 13, 2025












Arseny Shatokhin: Developers need to prepare for a future of agentic coding



AI Technology



Arseny Shatokhin provides actionable advice for developers to adapt to the rapidly changing landscape of AI in software development, emphasizing the need for mastering AI tools, building autonomous AI agents, and shifting towards strategic roles.





May 13, 2025












IndyDevDan Voice to Claude Code SPEAK to SHIP Agentic Coding AI Assistant



Building Stuff

Coding



IndyDevDan demonstrates a custom-built AI assistant that uses real-time speech-to-text to capture voice commands, processes them with Anthropic’s Claude Code, and responds with voice output, enabling developers to interact with their codebase through natural language speech.





May 12, 2025












Cole Medin: The 7 Node Blueprint for AI Agents in n8n



Building Stuff

n8n

AI Agents



Cole Medin introduces the “Seven Node Blueprint for AI Agents,” a structured framework for building complex AI agents in n8n, emphasizing the graph-like nature of agents and how to break down tasks into manageable components.





May 12, 2025












James Medoo: How to Become The Go-To Expert in the AI Content Storm!



AI in Education



James Medoo discusses the overwhelming influx of AI-generated content and how to stand out as an expert in this “AI content storm.” He emphasizes the importance of building a personally branded campus that leverages human elements like trust, community and personalized context, which AI cannot replicate. Medoo outlines the five C’s of success: Curate, Context, Community, Credibility, and Care, and provides practical steps for creating a sustainable education business in the age of AI.





May 6, 2025












SuperHumans Life: Become a One Person Business



AI in Business



Allowing individuals to build successful one-person businesses without the need for teams, funding, or large audiences? The focus is on leveraging AI as a primary workforce and creating systems that automate operations, enabling solopreneurs to achieve significant profits.





May 5, 2025












Codex Community: Claude & MCP - Top 10 MCP Use Cases



Building Stuff

MCP

AI Agents



Codex Community showcases the Model Context Protocol (MCP) and its top 10 use cases, demonstrating how AI agents like Claude can interact with various tools and services to automate tasks, manage files, send emails, and more.





May 4, 2025












Eduards Ruzga: Claude with MCPs Replaced Cursor & Windsurf



Building Stuff

Coding

MCP



Eduards Ruzga explains how he has stopped using tools like Windsurf and Cursor, instead opting for a system that combines Anthropic’s Claude AI with MCPs. He demonstrates the capabilities of his MCP server, which allows Claude to interact with the local machine, run long processes, access the file system, and edit code files.





May 2, 2025












Mark Zuckerberg and Satya Nadella at Llamicon 2025, by Matthew Berman



AI Technology



Fireside chat between Mark Zuckerberg and Satya Nadella at Llamicon 2025, focusing on AI’s role in coding, self-improving AI, and the future of software development.





May 1, 2025












n8n Automatiseringseksempler



AI in Business

n8n



Brainstorm med LLM: Liste over 50 automatiseringseksempler, der kan implementeres med n8n, kategoriseret for nem reference. Disse eksempler dækker områder som e-handel, markedsføring, datahåndtering, AI-integration og mere.





Apr 30, 2025












Andrej Karpathy’s Deep Dive into LLMs



AI Technology

Andrej Karpathy



Andrej Karpathy’s on Large Language Models (LLMs) like ChatGPT, covering their architecture, training stages, capabilities, limitations, and implications, 5. feb. 2025.





Apr 20, 2025












Diet



Diet

Prompts



Create a personalized diet plan focused on low insulin impact, anti-inflammatory properties, with low to moderate meat intake and flexibility.





Apr 19, 2025












James Medoo: AI use cases and tools



AI in Education



James Medoo discusses how custom AI agents, particularly Custom GPTs, are transforming education businesses by focusing on personalized application of knowledge rather than static content. It highlights the use of AI tools to automate complex tasks, generate ideas, and conduct deep research, inspiring new ways to integrate AI into daily workflows.





Apr 18, 2025












Yann LeCun Says He DONE With LLMS



AI Technology

Yann LeCun



Yann LeCun, Meta’s Chief AI Scientist, expresses his disinterest in LLMs at Nvidia GTC 2025, advocating for a shift towards understanding the physical world and developing abstract representations, 16. apr. 2025





Apr 17, 2025












China trade conflict and stock market by Frank Sieren



Investing & Global politics



Frank Sieren discussing the US-China trade conflict, the Chinese stock market, and investment opportunities in China, 14. apr. 2025





Apr 14, 2025












10 Key Breakthrough Technologies of 2025



AI Technology



Neil Firth from MIT Technology Review presents the top 10 breakthrough technologies expected to have a significant impact in 2025, including advancements in AI, robotics, sustainable energy, and healthcare.





Apr 12, 2025












AI Automation (2025) in 5 Industries



AI in Business



Nick Saraev discusses five industries with potential for automation solutions. The industries include coaching and consulting, recruitment and staffing, digital marketing agencies, high-touch B2B tech companies, and financial services. For each industry, he outlines the pain points that make them ideal candidates for automation and suggests specific solutions that can be sold to them.





Apr 11, 2025

A summary of how Andrej Karpathy uses LLMs, 27. feb. 2025

Yan LeCun on AI’s impossible Math Problem

Yann LeCun



In this interview, Yann LeCun discusses the limitations of current AI systems, the challenges of understanding the physical world, and the future of AI assistants, 7. mar. 2025

title: LLM dialogues
text:
Why?

Accelerating Knowledge Acquisition

LLMs excel at rapidly processing and synthesizing extensive information, delivering direct answers that save us valuable time.
However, true knowledge acquisition requires still a balanced approach — while AI efficiently extracts and presents data, we must still engage in thoughtful reflection, reread the information to do measured consideration of complex information.
We want to transform this accelerated input into effective decision support and deeper understanding.
